responseMessages.message: The request was improperly formatted or contained invalid fields.

operations.notes: Create a new Kerberos Realm. If the Kerberos Realm is not properly configured, a 422 status code is returned along with a list of validation errors that must be corrected.

responseMessages.message: The request was improperly formatted or contained invalid fields.

operations.summary: Find a Kerberos Realm by ID.
operations.notes: Get a Kerberos Realm with the specified ID. A 404 status code is returned for nonexistent IDs.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Kerberos Realm to fetch.

operations.summary: Update a Kerberos Realm by ID.
operations.notes: Update a Kerberos Realm with the specified ID. A 404 status code is returned for nonexistent IDs.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the Kerberos Realm to update.

responseMessages.message: The request was improperly formatted or contained invalid fields.

operations.notes: Delete a Kerberos Realm with the specified ID. A 404 status code is returned for nonexistent IDs. Note: If the request succeeds, the response body is empty. If the request fails, an ApiResult is returned with details of the error.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of Kerberos Realm to delete.

items.description: The actual list of kerberos realms.

id.description: The persistent, unique ID for the Kerberos Realm. It can be any combination of [a-z0-9._-]. This property is system-assigned if not specified.

kerberosRealmName.description: The Domain/Realm name used for display in UI screens.

keyDistributionCenters.description: The Domain Controller/Key Distribution Center Host Action Names.

kerberosPassword.description: The Domain/Realm password. GETs will not return this attribute. To update this field, specify the new value in this attribute.

kerberosEncryptedPassword.description: For GET requests, this field contains the encrypted Domain/Realm password, if one exists. For POST and PUT requests, if you wish to reuse the existing password, this field should be passed back unchanged.

suppressDomainNameConcatenation.description: Controls whether the KDC hostnames and the realm name are concatenated in the auto-generated krb5.conf file. Default is false.

fieldPath.description: The path to the model field to which the error relates, if one exists.

KerberosRealmsSettings.description: Settings for all of the Kerberos Realms.

kdcRetries.description: Reference to the default Key Distribution Center Retries.

kdcTimeout.description: Reference to the default Key Distribution Center Timeout (in seconds).

ApiResult.description: Details on the result of the operation.

validationErrors.description: List of validation errors, if any.
